title: Some of the Best Places and Tourist Attraction Sites in Tenerife Island
text:
16, 2015 
Over the years Tenerife has changed and is now one of the best destinations on the Atlantic. The last two decades have seen a facelift of an unrecognizable island to the best destination with almost no comparison 
Tenerife is the highest and largest of all the Canary Islands which are an Atlantic Ocean’s luxury destination. The offering in the island are vast and so you need the best Travel Guide to Tenerife to know what to visit and when to visit. There is a wide range of the world’s finest accommodation options which will assure you of the perfect stay while on the island. 
Some of the attractions range from the beautifully kept and well maintained sandy beaches to awesome golf courses. There are also many sporting activities and breathtaking countryside to be explored. You can never have enough of Tenerife Island and so the best travel guide to Tenerife should simply expose you to popular holiday scenes. Some of the major tourist attractions of Tenerife Island are:- 
Garachico 
The historical town of Garachico has to be on your travel tips Tenerife as it offers many and different experiences of Tenerife especially for those tourists who are enthusiastic about history and the traditional side of their destinations. The once prosperous port town of Garachico suffered a long duration of volcanic eruption which occurred in 1706. This destroyed the port and created rock pools which are now rich in water life. They are also a perfect place for swimming in. 
Masca 
It is ideal for a great scenery and is located in the northwest tip of the Tenerife island. If you like awesome pictures then you can't leave Tenerife Islands before visiting the picturesque village of Masca. It is a small village set in Teno Mountains and on to the slopes of deep and green ravine which is beside narrow road made of alarming hairpin bends. It is undoubtedly the best thriller in the island. 
Piramides de Guimar 
It is on the east coast of the island and should be included in the best travel guide to Tenerife. It is also south of The Santa Cruz. A lot of archeologist have been to it and are yet to discern its origins. However, history of the pyramids show that it is the remains of the agricultural stone terraces together with random piles of stones which were cleared from various field by early settlers in Spain. It is also a good place to visit if you want to be in touch with the history of Tenerife Island. 
Teide National Park 
Its Spanish name is The Parque Nacional de las Canadas del Teide. It was declared a protected area back in 1954. Its recognition has been because of offering some of the most spectacular sceneries and landscapes in the world. These include an enormous crater created after volcanic action. The thrill factor of the crater is that it has a circumference of 30 miles or 48 km and out of it rises the highest peak in Spain called Mount Teide.
